comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called 20th-Century Prefab Homes, and we'd love to have your photo added to the group.

comment._content: Those are nicer than Katrina trailers.

comment.author: 22349924@N08
comment._content: this is my favourite one so far

comment.author: 38326251@N06
comment._content:
these row shelters were usually two or three room homes. also, there was't any air conditioning nor heating. the stoves oven, if it had one, was used as the heater. this looks like a saturday or sunday afternoon. most are dressed in their sunday best.
these labor camps were scattered all the way down to Brownsville. we lived in one in Harlingen.
